xxl.applications.pipes.auctions
Class NEXMarkGeneratorSource

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.sources.AbstractSource
          xxl.applications.pipes.auctions.NEXMarkGeneratorSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
Node, Source, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class NEXMarkGeneratorSource
extends AbstractSource

This class connects data generated by the NEXMark generator to PIPES. The original NEXMark generator has been modified to generate three files (person.xml, auction.xml & bid.xml). (see xxl.applications.pipes.auctions.nexmark)
The first file can be connected, by calling the static getPersonCursor method, resulting in a cursor that delivers an instance of 'Person' per call.
The latter two can be used by using the constructor. This constructs a Source, that delivers OpenAuction instances
Because the mapping from xml to java is done by castor, a mapping file is required. It is the same for all three (xxl.applications.pipes.auctions.mapping.NEXMark-mapping.xml)
Note, that prettyprint MUST be activated during file generation in the NEXMark generator.

auctionsIndex

protected int auctionsIndex
An index, which is only required for the auction stream. It is used to determine the correct tuple in the process method.

auctionIndex

protected int auctionIndex
An index, which is only required for the auction stream. It is used to determine the correct tuple in the process method.

function

protected Function function
A function, that can be used to transforms a TimestampedObject. every time before a tuple is passed to it's sinks the function is invoked on it. this feature can be used to tranform the complex nexmark objects to simpler objects that contain only the informations that are interessting. two standard functions have been added to this class.

prices

protected HashMap prices
Maps item ids to Price instances. Price contains startprice, sellprice and buyer. It is used to determine the start price, the sell price and the buyer with a Bid_Cursor. if an entry for an item is present, the Price instance is used, otherwise a random start price is generated.

random

protected Random random
This random instance is used to generate the first price, if no person send a bid to an article.

Constructor Detail

NEXMarkGeneratorSource

public NEXMarkGeneratorSource(String sourcePath,
                              String mapFile,
                              int fileType,
                              Function function,
                              float factor,
                              boolean computePrices)
Constructs a new source, that will deliver TimestampedObject instances. The content of a such an object is an OpenAuction instance if no function has been specified or an arbitary object else. the creation of an interval (TimestampedObject) depends on the stream. BID: A bid has only a timestamp. therefore the timestamp is inserted as the start of the interval and timestamp+1 is used as end. a temporal window is necessary to use the interval correctly. Auction: An Auction has an intervall, which is used to create the interval directly.

Parameters:
sourcePath - the path to the xml files, generated by the modified NEXMark generator. it is assumed, that the source files have the following names: auction.xml, bid.xml and person.xml.
mapFile - a file, that is required to map xml to java objects with castor. use xxl.applications.pipes.auctions.mapping.NEXMark-mapping.xml
fileType - the filetype. allowed are auction and bid stream.
function - a function that is invoked on a tupel before it is passed to its sinks. it is invoked on a TimestampObjekt and can be used to tranform the tuple.
factor - a factor to speed up or slow down the original tupel rate. for instance 0,5 will increase the speed by 100%, 2 decrease the speed to 50% of the original rate.
computePrices - determines if the start and sell price of an item should be computed explicitly.

NEXMarkGeneratorSource

public NEXMarkGeneratorSource(String sourcePath,
                              String mapFile,
                              int fileType,
                              Function function,
                              float factor)
Constructs a new source, that will deliver TimestampedObject instances. NEXMarkGeneratorSource

public NEXMarkGeneratorSource(String sourcePath,
                              String mapFile,
                              int fileType,
                              float factor)
Constructs a new source, that will deliver TimestampedObject instances, if a valid stream taype has been specified. the creation of an interval (TimestampedObject) depends on the stream. BID: A bid has only a timestamp. therefore the timestamp is inserted as the start of the interval and timestamp+1 is used as end. a temporal window is necessary to use the interval correctly. Auction: An Auction has an intervall, which is used to create the interval directly.

Parameters:
sourcePath - the path to the xml files, generated by the modified NEXMark generator. it is assumed, that the source files have the following names: auction.xml, bid.xml and person.xml.
mapFile - a file, that is required to map xml to java objects with castor. use xxl.applications.pipes.auctions.mapping.NEXMark-mapping.xml
fileType - the filetype. allowed are auction and bid stream.
factor - a factor to speed up or slow down the original tupel rate. for instance 0,5 will increase the speed by 100%, 2 decrease the speed to 50% of the original rate.

Method Detail

getPersonCursor

public static Cursor getPersonCursor(String sourceFile,
                                     String mapFile)
Returns a cursor, that delivers 'Person' instances for each person element generated by the modified NEXMark generator.

Parameters:
sourceFile - the modified sourcefile generated by castor. an incompatible type will result in a nullpointer or classcast exception.
mapFile - a file, that is required to map xml to java objects with castor. use xxl.applications.pipes.auctions.mapping.NEXMark-mapping.xml
Returns:
a cursor, that delivers 'Person' instances for each person element generated by the NEXMark generator.

Parameters:
sourceFile - the sourfile (bid.xml)
mapFile - a map for castor to map xml to java objects (NEXMark-mapping.xml).
Returns:
a cursor that delivers bid data.

mapFile - a map for castor to map xml to java objects (NEXMark-mapping.xml).
Returns:
a cursor that delivers the auction data.

makeClosedAuctionFile

public static void makeClosedAuctionFile(String path,
                                         String mapFile)
Reads the auction file "auction.xml", sorts it by the end timestamp and writes the result in a file "closedauction.xml".

Parameters:
path - the path to the sourcefile auction.xml.
mapFile - a map for castor to map xml to java objects (NEXMark-mapping.xml).

next

public Object next()
            throws NoSuchElementException
Description copied from class: AbstractSource
Abstract method that is called by the thread simulating the activity of this source with the intention to retrieve the next element. If this data source has no further elements that can be transferred, the method should throw a new NoSuchElementException.

Specified by:
next in class AbstractSource
Returns:
Object, an instances of TimestampedObject or an arbitary object, depending on the given function.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if all tuples have been delivered.

nextSleepTime

protected int nextSleepTime()
computes the next sleeptime. the method is used by an simple iterator.

Returns:
the sleeptime. values greater or equal zero will be used for the sleeptime. -1 means that no more tuples can be delivered.

Parameters:

mapFile - the castor mapping file
Returns:

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use an NEXMarkGeneratorSource. It can also be used to test the functionality of a NEXMarkGeneratorSource.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called. The following Arguments are required for a test
arg0: sourceFile, the file from which NEXMarkGeneratorSource gets its input
arg1: mapFile, a file mapping the xml input to java objects with castor. a mapping file has already been created (NEXMark-mapping.xml).
A lot of tests are in 'xxl.applications.pipes.Tests' (method: nexmarkTest).
